to_address: "'Speakup is a screen review system for Linux.'" <speakup@braille.uwo.ca>
subject: RE: patching 2.6.21 with speakup
body:
Hi Chuck,
Change it to linux-speakup.org til Kirk and I can get this fixed.
We have ftp going on fl.linux-speakup.org but we still have to finish up cvs
and web access.

Tom
 
-----Original Message-----
From: speakup-bounces@braille.uwo.ca [mailto:speakup-bounces@braille.uwo.ca]
On Behalf Of Chuck Hallenbeck
Sent: Monday, May 21, 2007 5:29 PM
To: Speakup is a screen review system for Linux.
Subject: patching 2.6.21 with speakup

Hi people,

It's been a long time since I rolled my own kernel, so maybe my
checkout script is no longer current. I put the source tree in the
right place, made a symbolic to it from /usr/src/linux, ran my old
checkout script, and got this:

Patching version v26
CVSROOT not set.  Enter it below.  Hit enter for anonymous.
CVSROOT>
Logging in to :pserver:anonymous@fl.linux-speakup.org:2401/usr/src/CVS
CVS password:
/usr/src/CVS: no such repository


Anybody see the problem here? Not sure what to try next.

Thanks,
Chuck

-- 
The Moon is Waxing Crescent (30% of Full)
 You can get downloads from http://www.mhcable.com/~chuckh/software.html
 The early bird may get the worm, but the second mouse gets the cheese.
